TOP STORIES
Advertisement
Advertisement
Advertisement

Ever Given partially 'refloated' in Suez Canal

The Ever Given has been "partially refloated" in what appears to be a first step to dislodging it from the Suez Canal. The container ship has been blocking the canal for nearly a week, holding up billions in trade.  Go to article  

Merkel wants states to do more to curb infections

German Chancellor Angela Merkel has urged federal states to do more to curb infections during a televised interview. She also suggested additional measures such as curfews to better combat the virus.  

US President Biden condemns Myanmar bloodshed

Nations including Germany and the US have jointly decried the military violence which killed over 100 people in one day.  

Several injured in Indonesia church bombing

Suicide bombers have struck outside a Catholic church in the Indonesian city of Makassar on Palm Sunday, injuring more than a dozen people. President Widodo said he "strongly condemned this act of terror."  

CORONAVIRUS

Trump adviser: US could have avoided most COVID-deaths

Dr. Deborah Birx, who coordinated the coronavirus task force under former US President Trump, said that deaths could have been avoided if the administration had responded more effectively. Follow DW for the latest.  

Paris doctors warn of 'catastrophe' on the horizon

Hospitals in the French capital may soon become so stretched doctors will have to choose which patients to try and save. President Macron has received the wrath of some doctors in letters penned in French newspapers.  

Defiant Dutch churchgoers attack journalists

Worshippers flouting pandemic measures in the Netherlands have responded to media attention with violence. Lawmakers have slammed the attacks on reporters.  

NEWS REPORTS

Floyd family holds prayer service ahead of trial

A jury will hear the opening arguments Monday in the trial of a former police officer facing a number of charges into the death of Black man George Floyd.  

Slovak PM offers job swap to end vaccine spat

Prime Minister Igor Matovic has pitched switching jobs to resolve the standoff over the ruling coalition's pandemic measures. However, some are calling for his removal entirely.  

Kurdish forces search Syria camp for IS members

Several people have been arrested in the al-Hol camp, home to tens of thousands of suspected supporters and families of IS militants. Kurdish forces are struggling to remain in control.  

Report: 13 states may face EU visa restrictions

EU officials accuse the governments of several countries of a lack of cooperation when it comes to readmitting citizens whose asylum applications have been rejected within the bloc, a German newspaper reports.  

Could Russia hack German navy and NATO subs?

A report that German submarines are navigating the globe with Russian hardware has sparked security concerns. The newspaper Bild claims that the equipment is "open" to cyber sabotage and even "full loss of operability."  

STORIES & ANALYSIS

Iraqi Yazidis warn of ongoing threats

A new law to aid Yazidi survivors isn't enough, say locals, warning that the community will be attacked again.  

Modi faces big electoral test in West Bengal

India's West Bengal has emerged as a key state for PM Modi's BJP, which is looking to extend its national domination.  

Why German politics isn't so transparent

Calls are growing for more robust rules to keep German politicians on the straight and narrow.  

Jews feel unwelcome in EU

A mass exodus from the EU could ensue, writes Pinchas Goldschmidt, the president of the Conference of European Rabbis.  

Most Read

Aggressive Asian hornets gain foothold in Pacific Northwest

Suez Canal: Ship blockage may be due to 'human errors'

Netherlands: Churchgoers breaking COVID rules attack journalists

DW News - News

Coming up at 08:30 UTC: Business

DW reporter detained, released in Belarus

Correspondent Nicholas Connolly was held for around five hours by Belarusian authorities before being released.  

New debate about Benin Bronzes in Germany

The debate about looted colonial art in German museums has gained new momentum. Even the foreign minister has chimed in.  

Advertisement

Monuments go dark for Earth Hour

Organizers WWF wanted to highlight the link between the destruction of nature and an increase in disease outbreaks.  

When tree planting does more harm than good

Is it time colonial-era assumptions about the value of drylands were challenged?  

Romania vs. Germany in World Cup qualifier

Joachim Löw's side got the job done but it wasn't the football that was the only focus in Bucharest.  

Lewis Hamilton wins Bahrain Grand Prix

In a thrilling and tactical battle, Max Verstappen couldn't overcome Lewis Hamilton to seal his first win in Bahrain.  

The future of tourism 26.03.2021

The tourism sector is reeling from the pandemic. But amid a climate crisis, can we afford a return to business as usual?
